newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT -Bunds to pause, pull back to 102.59.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT -Bunds to pause, pull back to 102.59.

text.p: September Bund futures traded on LIFFE will seek some consolidation on Wednesday before making another push higher, technical analysts said.

"We held support around 102.59, a key level, yesterday," said Elizabeth Miller, technical analyst at Deutsche Morgan Grenfell in London. "On candlestick charts we saw a small tweezer top, which is usually a sign of consolidataion.
"As well as that we just managed an inside day and momentum is starting to run out of steam on the top side."
Miller said all these factors suggested a pause for Wednesday and some sideways consolidation within the range.
At 0703 GMT, September Bund futures were at 102.91, up 15 basis points on the day.
"We have seen a very steep climb recently and it hasn't had a rest so the chances are for the next few days it is going to take a rest," Miller said.
She said the contract was likely to be capped by 103.00 for this session and to the downside, below 102.59 a further prop was offered at 102.17.
That level was the 38 percent Fibonnacci retracement of the rally from the low on June 20 at 100.94.
"Key support below there at 102.00 is not expected to give way, that would be our risk level," she said.
Technical analysts at a European bank in London said 102.00 was the first main support for Bunds, but did not see a pause in the rally.
"The current short term acceleration mode could see anything up to 104.00," they said in a reasearch note.
There was also a type of flag formation from late June, which if valid would target of 103.50, they said.
Miller did not see 103.00 resistance being broken until next week but once through there Bunds would move towards 103.20.
That level was the June 1997 contract high, she said, adding that a trendline from the daily continuation chart came in close to that level at 103.28.
"Once we get through there, there's nothing by blue sky until the all time continuation high at 104.04," Miller said.
At the short end, December Euromarks were at 96.79, up one basis point on the day.
